occupation: Co-founder and CEO at twoplus Fertility
summary:
I specialize in healthcare innovation and commercialization. 

A serial medtech entrepreneur, I have deep hands-on knowledge of many critical aspects of medtech product development/commercialization including product conceptualization, regulatory strategy, product-market fit, clinical trials, and regulatory clearance. As a former Fellow in the highly-competitive Stanford Biodesign Fellowship program, I utilize the Biodesign process as a key tool for innovation strategy.

Apart from my entrepreneurship work, I have mentored numerous startups, industry teams and students in official and unofficial capacities. I served as a Fellowship Consultant for the Singapore-Stanford Biodesign program, where I worked closely with the Fellowship Head to train Singapore-Stanford Biodesign Fellows and to develop new training programs. I also served in mentorship roles at National University of Singapore, such the Lean Launchpad and the Graduate Research Innovation Program (GRIP). Many of the teams I mentored have gone on to raise further funding.

experiences.title: Co-founder and CEO
experiences.description:
twoplus Fertility aims to become the go-to platform for any couple trying to conceive. The fertility health market is underserved with only 3% of the industry needing IVF. The rest of the market – the 97% and the TTC (i.e. trying to conceive) market – are faced with expensive and invasive solutions. 

twoplus Fertility is focused on building an ecosystem of proprietary fertility solutions that are affordable and easy-to-use. We are funded by, among others, Y-Combinator, Monks Hill Ventures, Medtech Alliance 2, and Golden Gate Ventures.

experiences.title: Co-Founder and CEO (Acquired)
experiences.description: Privi has developed a new technology for the management of bleeding and pain.  As the CEO, I led a team of top scientists, engineers, and clinicians in the product development and commercialization. Privi raised funding from seasoned medtech investors, Singapore government agencies and corporate companies.

experiences.title: Consultant: Fellowship Program
experiences.description:
In this role I trained the Singapore-Stanford Biodesign Fellows and Extension Fellows in  the Biodesign Innovation process. The teams I trained have gone on to raise further funding for their projects. The fellowship teams consisted of clinicians of various seniority, scientists, engineers and commercial folks. 

I also developed the initial design of the new Singapore Biodesign Fellowship program. This initial design now forms a large part of the fellowship that was launched in 2019.

experiences.company: A*STAR - Agency for Science, Technology and Research
experiences.title: Entrepreneur in Residence
experiences.description: I am the first person to become an Entrepreneur-in-Residence in Singapore-Stanford Biodesign. The role was created after we raised funding for the technology that was initially developed during our fellowship. We completed the first phase of product development and spun-off the company.

experiences.title: Strategic Marketing Extern
experiences.description: Conducted detailed market research and analysis for a new product line developed by Resmed.

experiences.title: Global Biodesign Fellow
experiences.description: The fellowship is a highly selective program to train the next generation of medical device innovators and thought leaders

education.description: Head Prefect of the one of the top secondary schools in Kuala Lumpur

accomplishment_patents.title: DEVICES AND METHODS FOR PREVENTION OF VENTILATOR ASSOCIATED PNEUMONIA
accomplishment_patents.description:
Devices and methods for preventing ventilator associated 
pneumonia following intubating a patient with an endotracheal tube (ETT). Secretions that 
accumulate in the trachea above the ETT cuff are wicked out of the patient.

Currently being developed a Bay Area startup
